column1: Prior to the arrival of the Spanish
column2: the area around Rosemead was populated by Native Americans known as the people of the willow houses or better known as the Kizh (pronounced Keech)
column3: or as the Spaniards renamed them
column4: the Gabrieleños.  In 1771
column5: the Spanish founded the first Mission San Gabriel Arcángel in the area that was formally known as the village of Shevaangna or Siba what is [first Angeleno William McCawley 1996] now known as La Mision Veija or Whittier Narrows on the border between Montebello and Rosemead. In 1775
column6: the mission  moved to avoid the spring floods that ruined the first crops
column7: to its present location in San Gabriel formally known as the village of Tovisvanga .During the Spanish Colonial era
column8: the area that is now the City of Rosemead was part of the land administered by the San Gabriel Mission.  As part of the Mexican government's Secularization Act of 1833

column14: Anglo-American immigration began to flow to the area.  The southern part of Rosemead was part of Rancho Potrero Grande (Large Pasture) which was originally granted to a Native American man named Manuel Antonio
column15: who was a "mayordomo" (overseer) at the San Gabriel Mission.  The 4
column16: 431-acre (18 km2) ranch was later transferred to Juan Matias Sánchez.In 1852

column18: to the San Gabriel Valley from Conway County
column20: the couple camped where present-day Savannah Elementary School is located on Rio Hondo Avenue. They rented the land until 1867
column21: when John Guess purchased 100 acres (0.4 km2) of a 1
column22: 164-acre (5 km2) ranch and named it Savannah. The land stretched from Valley Boulevard to Marshall Street
column23: and from Rosemead Boulevard to the Eaton Wash.

column2: Frank Forst and Leonard John Rose
column3: also settled in this valley. Rose and his wife Amanda bought about 600 acres (2.4 km2) of land between what is now Rosemead Boulevard and Walnut Grove Avenue. Rose bred and trained horses for a living. He named his ranch "Rose's Meadow" which was eventually shortened to   Rosemeade and gave the city its name. Rosemeade  was once again shortened to Rosemead. The  peaceful
column4: pastoral community  flourished with small truck farms and rabbit and chicken farms. Settlers moved in and also raised vegetables
column6: grain and feed for the animals. It wasn't until August 4
column8: the citizens elected to incorporate Rosemead into a city.

column1: Rosemead Airport is one of the vanished former airports  which once were spread all throughout the Los Angeles metropolitan area.  Western Air College operated the airport.  The airport at this location in Rosemead was apparently built at some point between 1940–42
column2: as it was not depicted on  a 1940 LA street map. The earliest depiction of this airport was on a 1942 street map
column3: which labeled the field as the Western Air College Airport. At some point between 1942-44 the airport was renamed Rosemead
column4: as that is how it was labeled on the 1944 LA Sectional Aeronautical Chart (courtesy of John Voss). A flying school was also operated at Rosemead Airport.Fletcher Aviation acquired the airport from the Heasley brothers during the Korean War

column1: and later sold to AJ Industries in the 1960s
column2: AJ immediately sold the portion of the land from Rio Hondo Avenue almost to Rosemead Boulevard to AeroJet Corporation and they built a large facility there.  It was named Flair Park and the roadway that parallels I-10 was named Flair Drive.

Fire protection in Rosemead is provided by the Los Angeles County Fire Department with ambulance transport by American Medical Response. The Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department provides law enforcement
column2: operating out of the Temple City Station.
the international family of companies providing electric services
column3: is headquartered in the city. Southern California Edison serves Rosemead
column4: as well as much of Southern California.  The University of the West moved from its location from Hsi Lai Temple in Hacienda Heights to its current location in Rosemead in 1996 and is one of the first Buddhist funded universities in the United States. The Rosemead School of Psychology
column5: which is now located with Biola University in La Mirada
column6: was named after its original location in Rosemead and was the first independent professional school of psychology in the nation to be accredited by regional accrediting association. The Chinese cuisine fast food chain Panda Restaurant Group is headquartered in Rosemead. The Chinese-Vietnamese Sriracha red chili sauce (known to many as Rooster sauce) manufacturer Huy Fong Foods

column1: Rosemead is served by two elementary school districts: Garvey School District and Rosemead School District. Each of these districts overlaps with a high school district; the former overlaps with the Alhambra Unified School District and the latter overlaps with a portion of the El Monte Union High School District.
There is one public high school--Rosemead High School (of El Monte UHS)—in the city and three public middle schools: Muscatel Middle School
column2: Richard Garvey Intermediate School and Roger W. Temple Intermediate School. The portion in Garvey SD with Alhambra USD high school zoning is zoned to San Gabriel High School. A portion is also zoned to the Montebello Unified School District.Don Bosco Technical Institute
column3: a private Catholic high school for boys.

column1: University of the West has been located in Rosemead since 1996. UWest is Rosemead's only Western Association of Schools and Colleges accredited campus.
The Dinsmoor Heritage House is a bijou museum that houses
column2: preserves and displays a showcase of the colorful and rich history of the City of Rosemead.  Once a private home
column3: it was built in the late 1920s by Adelberrt Dinsmoor
column4: son of one of Rosemead's pioneers
column5: Raphael Dinsmoor. Currently closed to undergoing refurbishing
column6: it will again conduct monthly tours and host a variety of special events when completed. It is located at 9642 Steele Street.The Marinelli Stadium
column7: named in memory of Rod Marinelli
column8: formerly the head coach of the Detroit Lions
column9: is located at Rosemead High School.  "Rod Marinelli Stadium" appears in lights above the scoreboard and an encrypted bronze marker is placed at the southern edge of the field on a large  stone.There are two community centers in Rosemead that offer multi-purpose facilities for a large variety of occasions as well as  senior activities
column12: as well as two preschools.The city has completed a complete renovation
column14: at both city aquatic centers.  Rosemead Aquatic Center
column17: water polo and diving facilities as well as swim classes and recreation areas. Garvey Aquatic Center is now a state of the art recreational aquatic facility featuring water slides
column18: interactive play areas and a lesson pool. Showers at both pools have been updated for resource efficiency. The city completed these plans on schedule for the summer of 2011.  Garvey Aquatic Center was funded entirely through a grant from the State of California. Rosemead Aquatic Center was funded by bond proceeds.

column2: many Southern families settled in El Monte
column3: then called Lexington. The community of Rosemead
column4: then called Savannah
column5: is located adjacent to El Monte and is situated above the water table. The slightly elevated land made it the logical alternative as the burial site for residents of swampy Lexington. The first known burial was in 1846
column6: five years before most of the settlers arrived. Today the 41/2 acre cemetery
column7: with 200 plots remaining of its original 3
column9: is  privately owned by the El Monte Cemetery Association.  When the City of Rosemead started to widen Valley Boulevard in the 1920s
column10: construction crews unearthed dozens of corpses outside the fence of the cemetery. The majority of the skeletons were reburied in a mass grave inside the cemetery proper
column11: but some were so deteriorated that the workers left them undisturbed and simply paved over them so that there are more graves scattered under Valley Boulevard and beneath adjacent area businesses. The area also was a Native American burial ground before the bodies of settlers filled the cemetery.

column1: Savannah Pioneer Cemetery is located at the intersection of Mission Dr. and Valley Blvd. It is reputed to be the oldest Protestant cemetery in Los Angeles County. The El Monte Cemetery Association
column3: is responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the cemetery. The association's funding comes from private donations and fundraising activities.

column1: A small portion of the Montebello Town Center is actually located within Rosemead city limits. It features major department stores
column2: smaller shops and a small food court. The boundary line between Montebello and Rosemead runs through the eastern end of the shopping mall. Policing is provided by the City of Montebello.
